content.p: Our clinical epidemiology research, which has impacted substantially on healthcare policy, spans multiple disease areas including:- Particular methodological strengths are development and use of large e-health databases, conduct of cohort studies in developing countries, systematic reviews and meta-analyses. Across many different clinical areas there are gaps in our knowledge of the true burden of disease, those most at risk of developing disease, short and long-term consequences of illness and the effectiveness and safety of current therapies. Clinical epidemiology is a broad discipline which contributes much needed evidence to try and fill some of these gaps and is used by practising clinicians and by health policy makers. Cancer epidemiology Studying the causes and outcomes of cancer and strategies for early detection, making extensive use of e-health databases.
